blocks.name: cabv
blocks.content: The set of absolute values on a ring.
blocks.origin: const class cabv { AbsVal }

diff.cabv.c

df-abv
blocks.content: Define the set of absolute values on a ring. An absolute value is a generalization of the usual absolute value function ~ df-abs to arbitrary rings. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Sep-2014.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-abv(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wceq(cabv, cmpt(s0, crg, crab(s1, co(co(nat0, cico, cpnf), cmap, cfv(cbs, cv(s0))), wral(s2, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wa(wb(wceq(cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2)), nat0), wceq(cv(s2), cfv(c0g, cv(s0)))), wral(s3, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wa(wceq(cfv(cv(s1), co(cv(s2), cfv(cmulr, cv(s0)), cv(s3))), co(cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2)), cmul, cfv(cv(s1), cv(s3)))), wbr(cfv(cv(s1), co(cv(s2), cfv(cplusg, cv(s0)), cv(s3))), cle, co(cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2)), caddc, cfv(cv(s1), cv(s3)))))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
}

  raleqbidv(s2, cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)), c2, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wa(wceq(cfv(cv(s0), co(cv(s1), cfv(cmulr, cv(hs0)), cv(s2))), co(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cmul, cfv(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wbr(cfv(cv(s0), co(cv(s1), cfv(cplusg, cv(hs0)), cv(s2))), cle, co(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s1)), caddc, cfv(cv(s0), cv(s2))))), wa(wceq(cfv(cv(s0), co(cv(s1), c4, cv(s2))), co(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cmul, cfv(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wbr(cfv(cv(s0), co(cv(s1), c5, cv(s2))), cle, co(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s1)), caddc, cfv(cv(s0), cv(s2))))))

blocks.name: isabv
blocks.content: Elementhood in the set of absolute values. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Sep-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm isabv(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, crg), wb(wcel(c1, c2), wa(wf(c1, c3, co(nat0, cico, cpnf)), wral(s0, c3, wa(wb(wceq(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), nat0), wceq(cv(s0), c4)), wral(s1, c3, wa(wceq(cfv(c1, co(cv(s0), c5, cv(s1))), co(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cmul, cfv(c1, cv(s1)))), wbr(cfv(c1, co(cv(s0), c6, cv(s1))), cle, co(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), caddc, cfv(c1, cv(s1)))))))))))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cabv, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(cplusg, c0))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cmulr, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(c0g, c0))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
} = {
  syl6bb(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c1, c2), wa(wf(c1, c3, co(nat0, cico, cpnf)), wral(s0, c3, wa(wb(wceq(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), nat0), wceq(cv(s0), c4)), wral(s1, c3, wa(wceq(cfv(c1, co(cv(s0), c5, cv(s1))), co(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cmul, cfv(c1, cv(s1)))), wbr(cfv(c1, co(cv(s0), c6, cv(s1))), cle, co(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), caddc, cfv(c1, cv(s1))))))))), wcel(c1, crab(hs0, co(co(nat0, cico, cpnf), cmap, c3), wral(s0, c3, wa(wb(wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), nat0), wceq(cv(s0), c4)), wral(s1, c3, wa(wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), co(cv(s0), c5, cv(s1))), co(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), cmul, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))), wbr(cfv(cv(hs0), co(cv(s0), c6, cv(s1))), cle, co(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), caddc, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))))))))))

blocks.name: abvrcl
blocks.content: Reverse closure for the absolute value set. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Sep-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm abvrcl(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, crg))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cabv, c2))

blocks.name: abvtriv
blocks.content: The trivial absolute value. (This theorem is true as long as ` R ` is a domain, but it is not true for rings with zero divisors, which violate the multiplication axiom; ~ abvdom is the converse of this remark.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Sep-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 6-May-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm abvtriv(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cdr), wcel(c1, c2))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cabv, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(c0g, c0))
  -| wceq(c1, cmpt(s0, c3, cif(nat0, nat1, wceq(cv(s0), c4))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
} = {
  abvtrivd(s0, hs0, hs1, c1, c2, c0, c3, c4, cfv(cmulr, c0), wcel(c0, cdr))
  drngring(c0)
  simprd(w3a(wcel(c0, cdr), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c3), wne(cv(hs0), c4)), wa(wcel(cv(hs1), c3), wne(cv(hs1), c4))), wne(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmulr, c0), cv(hs1)), c4), wcel(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmulr, c0), cv(hs1)), c3))
  sylib(w3a(wcel(c0, cdr), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c3), wne(cv(hs0), c4)), wa(wcel(cv(hs1), c3), wne(cv(hs1), c4))), wa(wcel(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmulr, c0), cv(hs1)), c3), wne(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmulr, c0), cv(hs1)), c4)), wcel(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmulr, c0), cv(hs1)), cdif(c3, csn(c4))))
  syl3anbr(wcel(c0, cdr), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c3), wne(cv(hs0), c4)), wa(wcel(cv(hs1), c3), wne(cv(hs1), c4)), wcel(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmulr, c0), cv(hs1)), cdif(c3, csn(c4))), wcel(c0, cdr), wcel(cv(hs0), cdif(c3, csn(c4))), wcel(cv(hs1), cdif(c3, csn(c4))))
  biid(wcel(c0, cdr))
  eldifsn(cv(hs0), c3, c4)
  eldifsn(cv(hs1), c3, c4)
  drngmcl(c0, cv(hs0), c3, c4, cv(hs1), cfv(cmulr, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cmulr, c0))
  eldifsn(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmulr, c0), cv(hs1)), c3, c4)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cmulr, c0)
  diff.cmulr.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, cdr)
  diff.cdr.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c0, cdr))
  diff.hs1.w(wcel(c0, cdr))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm abvtriv(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ DivRing → c1 ∈ c2)
  ⊣ c2 =(AbsVal ` c0)
  ⊣ c3 =(Base ` c0)
  ⊣ c4 =(0 ` c0)
  ⊣ c1 =(s0 ∈ c3 ↦ if(s0 = c4, 0, 1))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
  ⊣ d(s0, c4)
} = {
  abvtrivd(s0, hs0, hs1, c1, c2, c0, c3, c4, (× ` c0), c0 ∈ DivRing)
  drngring(c0)
  simprd((c0 ∈ DivRing ∧(hs0 ∈ c3 ∧ hs0 ≠ c4)∧(hs1 ∈ c3 ∧ hs1 ≠ c4)), (hs0[(× ` c0)]hs1)≠ c4, (hs0[(× ` c0)]hs1)∈ c3)
  sylib((c0 ∈ DivRing ∧(hs0 ∈ c3 ∧ hs0 ≠ c4)∧(hs1 ∈ c3 ∧ hs1 ≠ c4)), ((hs0[(× ` c0)]hs1)∈ c3 ∧(hs0[(× ` c0)]hs1)≠ c4), (hs0[(× ` c0)]hs1)∈(c3 \ { c4 }))
  syl3anbr(c0 ∈ DivRing, (hs0 ∈ c3 ∧ hs0 ≠ c4), (hs1 ∈ c3 ∧ hs1 ≠ c4), (hs0[(× ` c0)]hs1)∈(c3 \ { c4 }), c0 ∈ DivRing, hs0 ∈(c3 \ { c4 }), hs1 ∈(c3 \ { c4 }))
  biid(c0 ∈ DivRing)
  eldifsn(hs0, c3, c4)
  eldifsn(hs1, c3, c4)
  drngmcl(c0, hs0, c3, c4, hs1, (× ` c0))
  eqid((× ` c0))
  eldifsn((hs0[(× ` c0)]hs1), c3, c4)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cmulr, c0)
  diff.cmulr.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, cdr)
  diff.cdr.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.w(c0 ∈ DivRing)
  diff.hs1.w(c0 ∈ DivRing)
}

blocks.name: abvpropd
blocks.content: If two structures have the same ring components, they have the same collection of absolute values. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Oct-2015.)
